cards.name: Pinsir

attacks.name: Power Pinch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grip and Squeeze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.flavorText: It grips prey with its pincers until the prey is torn in half. What it can't tear, it tosses far.

cards.name: Seedot

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.flavorText: When it dangles from a tree branch, it looks just like an acorn. It enjoys scaring other Pokémon.

cards.name: Kricketot

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 more damage for each heads.

cards.flavorText: Its legs are short. Whenever it stumbles, its stiff antennae clack with a xylophone-like sound.

cards.name: Kricketune

attacks.name: White Noise
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Draining Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: There is a village that hosts a contest based on the amazingly variable cries of this Pokémon.

cards.name: Shaymin-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: Does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Pansage
cards.flavorText: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

cards.name: Simisage

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Stadium Drain
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage and heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

cards.name: Foongus

attacks.name: Find a Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.flavorText: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.

cards.name: Amoonguss

abilities.name: Sporprise
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may use this Ability. If you do, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.flavorText: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

cards.name: Growlithe

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.flavorText: A Pokémon with a loyal nature, it will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.flavorText: A Pokémon with a loyal nature, it will remain motionless until it is given an order by its Trainer.

cards.name: Arcanine

abilities.name: Blazing Mane
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

cards.name: Arcanine

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: Its proud and regal appearance has captured the hearts of people since long ago.

cards.name: Moltres

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

cards.name: Pansear
cards.flavorText: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.

cards.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Stadium Burn
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.flavorText: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.

cards.name: Darumaka
cards.flavorText: Darumaka's droppings are hot, so people used to put them in their clothes to keep themselves warm.

cards.name: Litwick
cards.flavorText: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leaches off the life force of any who follow it.

cards.name: Lampent

attacks.name: Ember
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

cards.name: Chandelure

attacks.name: Flame Burst
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Inferno
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.flavorText: Being consumed in Chandelure's flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.

cards.name: Reshiram

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

cards.name: Reshiram-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Staryu

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon and heal all damage from this Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: If its body is torn, it can grow back if the red core remains. The core flashes at midnight.

cards.name: Starmie

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: At the center of its body is a red core, which sends mysterious radio signals into the night sky.

cards.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.flavorText: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

cards.name: Lapras

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.flavorText: It loves crossing the sea with people and Pokémon on its back. It understands human speech.

cards.name: Articuno

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.flavorText: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

cards.name: Panpour
cards.flavorText: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

cards.name: Simipour

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Stadium Wave
attacks.text: If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 30 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.flavorText: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.

cards.name: Basculin

attacks.name: Bared Fangs
attacks.text: If, before this Pokémon does damage, the Defending Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

cards.flavorText: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.

cards.name: Vanillite
cards.flavorText: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.

cards.name: Vanillish

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.flavorText: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon's habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

cards.name: Vanilluxe

abilities.name: Slippery Soles
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Crushing Ice
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Colorless

cards.flavorText: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and attack their foes with violent blizzards.

cards.name: Frillish

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Spit Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.flavorText: They paralyze prey with poison, then drag them down to their lairs, five miles below the surface.

cards.name: Jellicent

attacks.name: Vengeful Wish
attacks.text: If this Pokémon was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: They propel themselves by expelling absorbed seawater from their bodies. Their favorite food is life energy.

cards.name: Cubchoo

attacks.name: Sniffle
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Belt attack's base damage is 40.

cards.flavorText: Its nose is always running. It sniffs the snot back up because the mucus provides the raw material for its moves.

cards.name: Beartic

attacks.name: Daunt
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attack from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.flavorText: It can make its breath freeze at will. Very able in the water, it swims around in northern seas and catches prey.

cards.name: Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frozen Wings
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hail Blizzard
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Hail Blizzard during your next turn.

cards.name: Pikachu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.flavorText: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

cards.name: Raichu

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

cards.flavorText: Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.

cards.name: Zapdos

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thundering Hurricane
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.flavorText: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

cards.name: Shinx

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

cards.name: Shinx

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.flavorText: The extension and contraction of its muscles generates electricity. It glows when in trouble.

cards.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

cards.name: Luxio

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

cards.name: Luxray

attacks.name: Flash Impact
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: It can see clearly through walls to track down its prey and seek its lost young.

cards.name: Blitzle

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.flavorText: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use their flashing manes to communicate with one another.

cards.name: Zebstrika

attacks.name: Disconnect
attacks.text: Your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Lightning Crash
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 80 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.flavorText: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

cards.name: Emolga

attacks.name: Bounce
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

cards.name: Zekrom

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

cards.flavorText: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

cards.name: Zekrom-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Strong Volt
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Grimer

attacks.name: Nasty Goo
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.flavorText: It was born when sludge in a dirty stream was exposed to the moon's X-rays. It appears among filth.

cards.name: Muk

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Toxic Secretion
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on that Pokémon between turns.

cards.flavorText: A toxic fluids seeps from its body. The fluid instantly kills plants and trees on contact.

cards.name: Mewtwo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: X Ball
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psydrive
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ralts
cards.flavorText: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

cards.name: Kirlia

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

cards.name: Gardevoir

abilities.name: Psychic Mirage
abilities.text: Each basic Psychic Energy attached to your Psychic Pokémon provides PsychicPsychic Energy. You can't apply more than 1 Psychic Mirage Ability at a time.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.flavorText: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

cards.name: Munna
cards.flavorText: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

cards.name: Musharna

abilities.name: Forewarn
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may look at the top 2 cards of your deck, choose 1 of them, and put it into your hand. Put the other card back on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Fluffy Dream
attacks.text: This Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.flavorText: With the mist from its forehead, it can create shapes of things from dreams it has eaten.

cards.name: Darmanitan

attacks.name: Synchrodraw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: DarMAXitan
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.flavorText: When weakened in battle, it transforms into a stone statue. Then it sharpens its mind and fights on mentally.

cards.name: Elgyem

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.flavorText: It uses its strong psychic power to squeeze its opponent's brain, causing unendurable headaches.

cards.name: Beheeyem

attacks.name: Brain Control
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a card from there and put it on the bottom of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.flavorText: It can manipulate an opponent's memory. Apparently, it communicates by flashing its three different-colored fingers.

cards.name: Riolu

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.flavorText: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.

cards.name: Lucario

abilities.name: Reflexive Retaliation
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.flavorText: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

cards.name: Hippopotas

attacks.name: Sand Jet
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.flavorText: It shuts its nostrils tight then travels through sand as if walking. They form colonies of around ten.

cards.name: Hippowdon

attacks.name: Sand Bazooka
attacks.text: You may move 1 Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.flavorText: It is surprisingly quick to anger. It holds its mouth agape as a display of its strength.

cards.name: Mienfoo

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 times the number of heads.

cards.flavorText: They has mastered elegant combos. As they concentrate, their battle moves become swifter and more precise.

cards.name: Mienshao

attacks.name: Haul In
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: They use the long fur on their arms as a whip to strike their opponents.

cards.name: Sneasel

attacks.name: Corner
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.flavorText: A smart and sneaky Pokémon. A pair may work together to steal eggs by having one lure the parents away.

cards.name: Weavile

attacks.name: Dark Penalty
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has no Pokémon Tool card attached to it, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

cards.flavorText: Evolution made it even more devious. It communicates by clawing signs in boulders.

cards.name: Nuzleaf

attacks.name: Surprise Punch
attacks.text: Move an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: The sound of its grass flute makes its listeners uneasy. It lives deep in forests.

cards.name: Shiftry

abilities.name: Giant Fan
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Your opponent shuffles that Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: By flapping its leafy fan, it can whip up gusts of 100 ft/second that can level houses.

cards.name: Scraggy

attacks.name: Shed Skin
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.flavorText: It immediately headbutts anyones that makes eye contact with it. Its skull is massively thick.

cards.name: Scrafty

attacks.name: Rock Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Hammer Kick
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.flavorText: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the group leader.

cards.name: Bronzor

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.flavorText: There are researchers who believe this Pokémon reflected like a mirror in the distant past.

cards.name: Bronzong

abilities.name: Heal Block
abilities.text: Damage can't be healed from any Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Damage counters can still be moved.)

attacks.name: Oracle Inflict
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each card in your opponent's hand.

cards.flavorText: It brought rains by opening portals to another world. It was revered as a bringer of plentiful harvests.

cards.name: Ferroseed

attacks.name: Self Destruct
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 60 damage to itself.

cards.flavorText: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

cards.name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.flavorText: When it wavers its big, round eyes, it begins singing a lullaby that makes everyone drowsy.

cards.name: Wigglytuff

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.flavorText: Its fine fur feels sublime to the touch. It can expand its body by inhaling air.

cards.name: Meowth

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.flavorText: It is nocturnal in nature. If it spots something shiny, its eyes glitter brightly.

cards.name: Persian

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Shadow Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.flavorText: A very haughty Pokémon. Among fans, the size of the jewel in its forehead is a topic of much talk.

cards.name: Regigigas-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Power
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Raging Hammer
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Pidove

attacks.name: Scout
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand.

cards.flavorText: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

cards.name: Minccino

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.flavorText: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

cards.name: Cinccino

abilities.name: Smooth Coat
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.flavorText: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

cards.name: Cilan
rules: Search your deck for up to 3 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Exp. Share
rules: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.
When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card that was attached to that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Heavy Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon with a Retreat Cost of 3 or more, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Level Ball
rules: Search your deck for a Pokémon with 90 HP or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Pokémon Center
rules: Once during each player's turn, that player may heal 20 damage from 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Skyarrow Bridge
rules: The Retreat Cost of each Basic Pokémon is play is Colorless less.
This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
rules: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

cards.name: Prism Energy
rules: This card provides Colorless Energy.
If the Pokémon this card is attached to is a Basic Pokémon, this card provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time.

cards.name: Shaymin-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: Does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Reshiram-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Kyurem-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frozen Wings
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hail Blizzard
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Hail Blizzard during your next turn.

cards.name: Zekrom-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Strong Volt
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Mewtwo-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: X Ball
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psydrive
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Regigigas-EX
rules: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Giga Power
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Raging Hammer
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Emboar

abilities.name: Inferno Fandango
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

cards.name: Chandelure

abilities.name: Cursed Shadow
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Eerie Glow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

cards.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

cards.name: Zoroark

attacks.name: Nasty Plot
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Foul Play
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks and use it as this attack.

cards.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

cards.name: Hydreigon

abilities.name: Dark Aura
abilities.text: All Energy attached to this Pokémon are Darkness Energy instead of their usual type.

attacks.name: Berserker Blade
attacks.text: Does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.flavorText: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.
